context_of_use: This use case allows patients and pharmacists to access and review electronic prescriptions and transferred prescription data.
stakeholders_and_interests: patients want to access their prescriptions for reference
pharmacists want to know what medication patients need
description: This use case enables patients and pharmacists to view and review prescriptions to ensure proper medication management.
triggering_event: A patient or pharmacist requests to view prescriptions.
preconditions: The prescriptions must be available in the system
postconditions: The user successfully views the relevant prescriptions
assumptions: The system has a functioning database of prescriptions
Users have the necessary permissions to view prescriptions
requirements_met: The system shall allow patients to view their prescriptions
The system shall allow pharmacists to view transferred prescriptions
outstanding_issues: Clarification on data privacy measures for prescription viewing
main_flow: 1. patient → System displays the list of prescriptions for the patient
2. pharmacist → System displays the list of transferred prescriptions for the pharmacist
3. patient → System allows the patient to select a prescription to view details
4. pharmacist → System allows the pharmacist to select a prescription to view details
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the patient is using a mobile device, then the system displays the mobile-friendly version of the prescription list.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the user is not authenticated, then the system prompts the user to log in.
